function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Migration from urban to rural areas due to lack of space in multi-family housing","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient adequacy, equipment, flexibility, and adaptability of existing housing in the context of pandemic challenges","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survey revealing inadequate conditions in multi-family housing in podgorica","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Chronic or acute stresses to which urban resilience is exposed","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Division of stressors including natural hazards, resource scarcity, and social change","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on air quality and ventilation in residential environments","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate presence of outdoor and safe indoor spaces for socialization","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infrequent cleaning and lack of contactless technologies in residential spaces","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on health and safety in architectural space design","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate infrastructure for healthy living spaces","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accessibility of public spaces within 5 min walking distance","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in building facilities and overcrowding","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited adaptability of residential space to individual needs","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Residential space designed without consideration for disease propagation","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for societal changes and future challenges in the design","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accelerated industrialization and urban population increase","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Degradation of natural and urban spaces","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of urban and architectural concepts","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Anarchy in transitional period","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High density of construction and absence of greenery","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social infrastructure","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited organization of residential units","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to spend free time outdoors in smaller, controlled groups","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and overcrowding in multi-family housing","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of maintenance in aging residential buildings","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socialist-era architectural designs and construction may not meet modern health and safety standards","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social infrastructure and facilities such as health centers, nurseries, and kindergartens","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of green spaces and high greenery in residential areas","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of communal and social spaces within housing projects","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on flexibility of buildings may lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases within the residential area.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for distancing and segregation within the residential area may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration for the use and maintenance of communal areas may lead to increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Evaluating the resilience of existing housing stock and examining the guidelines for its improvement during a pandemic","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Respondents aged 19 to 70 years were included in the survey, potentially encompassing different susceptibility to contagious diseases.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of resilience in current residential buildings to current and future pandemics","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of contact with nature in residential buildings","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impossibility of self-isolation in common areas of the building","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Statistically significant predictors of satisfaction with living in apartments during the pandemic","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Living in an apartment during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of existing housing stock to the new resilient residential space concept","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in residential space design","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on market value over use value of residential space","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density in residential buildings","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate residential space for pandemic scenarios","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"General impoverishment of architectural work","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resilient residential model for pandemic adaptation","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased exposure to pathogens in densely populated environments","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indoor work places not designed to prevent the spread of airborne pathogens","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air distribution systems may enhance transmission of airborne pathogens","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of dilution method","category":"Air","confidence":"High"}]}
